Package it.polimi.ingsw.view

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.view.Client
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ClientRemote, java.rmi.Remote
    public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
implements ClientRemote
    This class contains all the necessary methods to communicate with the server. It represents the client-side access to the network

      This method is the constructor of the class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client​(int i,
              ViewInterface view,
              java.lang.String serverIp,
              java.lang.String clientIp)
       throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is the constructor of the class. It checks the parameters in input to determine if setup a connection using Sockets or RMI This constructor uses custom ip parameters
        Parameters:
        i - This parameter determines which type of connection must be used 0 - RMI 1 - Socket
        view - is the interface used to communicate with the user
        serverIp - is the ip of the server to connect to
        clientIp - is the ip of the client
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if any step of the setup goes wrong

      • Client

        public Client​(int i,
              ViewInterface view)
       throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is the constructor of the class. It checks the parameters in input to determine if setup a connection using Sockets or RMI This constructor uses default ip parameters, read from "network_settings.properties"
        Parameters:
        i - This parameter determines which type of connection must be used 0 - RMI 1 - Socket
        view - is the interface used to communicate with the user
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if any step of the setup goes wrong

                        throws java.rmi.RemoteException

        Returns:
        the boolean answer to the question chosen by the user

      • login

        public int login​(java.lang.String s)
        This method is used to login on the server using a specified nickname. If the login is successful, a ping-thread is started using the express method
        Parameters:
        s - is the nickname used to login
        Returns:
        an integer positive value that represents the outcome of the login (see the login remote method for the meanings), or -1 if the connection timeout expires

      • logout

        public void logout()
        This method is used to logout from the server. Note that if the logout is successful, the notification to the view of the logout is not performed by this method, but it is responsibility of the ping thread Also note that the case of logout not successful (which means that the network timeout expires before the logout is completed) is not handled, because it is responsibility of the ping thread to notice that

      • getModelUpdate

        public SmartModel getModelUpdate()
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is used to ask to the server an updated version of the game information
        Returns:
        de-serialized SmartModel, or null pointer if the smart model does not exist
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if something with the network goes wrong or the network timeout expires
